result.execSummary:
The defendant Evangeline Rose Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 4 of Burnett County Case 21CF211

1) The Court assessed only the DNA surcharge in this matter.
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

1) Restitution must be paid in full within 60 days from sentencing.
2) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has sixty (60) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    

Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).

defendant.name: Thompson, Evangeline Rose

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Evangeline Rose Thompson
Current: 15233 Galant Lane Apt 205, Apple Valley, MN 55124 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2022)
Prior: 2561 200 10Th Ave, Saint Croix Fall, WI 54024

2:47 PM Cases 21CF211 and 22CF74 called together.  Defendant Evangeline Rose Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Evangeline Rose Thompson.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases are on for Sentencing Hearing/Sentencing after revocation hearing.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI and ROAW, propose no corrections or modifications.  Victim 1 makes a statement to the court.  Victim 2 makes a statement to the court.  168 days jail credit stipulated to.  State argues for 9 months jail on the Ct 4 21CF211, probation on Ct 1 of 21CF211; 1 and 4 of 21CF211 consecutive to each other; regarding 22CF74- argues for probation or jail concurrent to 21CF211.  VW notes $165 restitution is requested in 22CF74; defendant stipulates to the restitution.  Defense attorney questions agreement.  State amends his recommendation regarding jail to time-served jail (7 months).  Atty Gramstrup makes sentencing argument.  Defendant makes a statement.  
Court orders: 
21CF211, Count 1- Battery to rescue worker: 3 yrs probation, withheld sentence; $518 court costs
21CF211, Count 4- Obstructing: 7 months jail, concurrent to 22CF74, 168 days jail credit; civil judgment to be entered for any remaining amounts owed.
22CF74, Count 4- Criminal Damage to property: 7 months jail; 168 days jail credit. $200 DNA court costs.  
Conditions of probation: 
No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Gainful employment.  No abusive contact with the victims.  If victims don't wish for her to be at their residence, she can't be at their residence.  Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life. Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored.  No possession or consumption of alcohol.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores. Report to probation immediately (no later than noon tomorrow if they are closed today).  $50 per month payments through probation.  Polk County case is DRI.  $165 restitution must be paid within 60 days.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Appeal rights provided.

1:39 PM Cases 21CF211 and 22CF74 called together. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Evangeline Rose Thompson in court, in custody. Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Evangeline Rose Thompson. Def waives all in person appearance KIV. Case is on for Plea Hearing. State assures VR compliance. Agreement is recited by Attorney Gramstrup: in 22CF74, def pleading to criminal damage to property (Ct 4); DJOC vacated in 21CF211 on Ct 1; requesting to do sentencing on both matters until PSI is prepared; Polk Cty case 21CF556 to be DRI as part of a global resolution. Court wants confirmation that the judge on the Polk County matter approves of this resolution; will officially DRI that matter at the sentencing if that is received. Court explains to def. Court asks def if they understand the agreement. Def does. Court reviews Def's constitutional rights. Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today. Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties. Def understands. Court notes- confirmation received that Judge Tolan is not opposed to the DRI of Polk County case 21CF556. Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty. Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds defendant guilty of Count 4 and orders a JOC; remaining counts are DRI; DJOC is vacated in 21CF211; 21CF556 is DRI. Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing. Defendant makes a statement.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plaintiff's Consent to Read-in Polk County case 21CF556

03:05 PM Cases 21CF211 and 22CF74 called together.  Defendant Evangeline Rose Thompson in court with attorney Chris A Gramstrup.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Evangeline Rose Thompson appeared by video means with Attorney also by video.  Case was on for PH in 22CF74, however, Attorney advises it will be a waiver and they have an agreement worked out.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.    Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Mr. Gramstrup advises Court of offer vacate DJOC in 21CF211, not object, enter plea of guilty to 22CF74, CDTP, remaining charges DRI, PSI ordered, free to argue, but State will not request additional up front jail time, but can argue for imposed & stayed jail sentence.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:28 PM Called 21CF211 for STC and 22CF74 for INIT. Defendant Evangeline Rose Thompson in court by video with Attorney Christian J Ness in person.  Defendant in custody of Burnett County Jail.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin in person.  Motion in 21CF211 case and INIT in 22CF74.   Case 22CF74 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  22CF74 case NG entered on misdemeanor, waive time limits on PH.  Def confirms contact info.  Set motion for entry of judgment and PH, Attny Ness requests to schedule for one more STC and PH working on global resolution.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
